definition: meaning (of foreign expression)/translation of the meaning (as opposed to literal translation 直譯|直译)/paraphrase/free translation
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: You can also practise scanning for paraphrases of key words.
sentences.chinese: 还可以通过意译重述关键词进行关键词转换练习。

sentences.english: INTRODUCTION People often discuss literal translation and free translation.
sentences.chinese: 引言人们经常讨论直译和意译。

sentences.english: People often discuss literal translation and free translation.
sentences.chinese: 引言人们经常讨论直译和意译。

sentences.english: As a result of the cultural difference, the transliteration definitely will bring the misregistration.
sentences.chinese: 但是由于文化的差异，意译必然会带来误读。

definition: formation of a loanword using a combination of characters or words that suggests its meaning (as opposed to transliteration 音譯|音译[yin1 yi4]) (e.g. 超文本[chao1 wen2 ben3], 火車|火车[huo3 che1])

transliteration (rendering phonetic value, e.g. of English words in Chinese characters)/characters giving phonetic value of Chinese word or name (when the correct characters may be unknown)/transcription (linguistics)/to transcribe phonetic symbols
translated word (such as company 公司 or bus 巴士 or club 俱樂部|俱乐部)
